qas.question: What can asexual reproduction techniques help annelids do?
What annelids make a cocoon in a ring around themselves?
What can asexual reproduction techniques prevent annelids from doing?
What annelids make a cocoon in a pyramid around themselves?

context: Although many species can reproduce asexually and use similar mechanisms to <a1_0><b6_0>regenerate after severe injuries<b6_0/><a1_0/>, <a0_0><b5_0>sexual reproduction<b5_0/><a0_0/> is the normal method in species whose reproduction has been studied. The minority of living polychaetes whose reproduction and lifecycles are known produce <a2_0><b7_0>trochophore<b7_0/><a2_0/> larvae, that live as plankton and then sink and metamorphose into miniature adults. <a3_0><a4_0><b8_0><b9_0>Oligochaetes<b9_0/><b8_0/><a4_0/><a3_0/> are full hermaphrodites and produce a ring-like cocoon around their bodies, in which the eggs and hatchlings are nourished until they are ready to emerge.
